title: How to Turn Off Ad Blocking in Google Chrome

steps.title: Click the three-dot menu in Chrome ⠇.
steps.content: Click the three-dot menu in Chrome ⠇ . It's the icon with three dots at the top-right corner of the Chrome web browser. [1] X Research source These steps will work to disable AdBlock in Chrome, as well as other ad-blocking Chrome extensions .

steps.title: Hover the mouse pointer over More tools.
steps.content: Hover the mouse pointer over More tools . It's near the bottom of the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Click Extensions.
steps.content: Click Extensions . This will bring you to a list of all of your installed extensions, including Adblock or any other ad-blocking Chrome extensions you use. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the switch under "AdBlock" to disable the extension.
steps.content: Click the switch under "AdBlock" to disable the extension. AdBlock is now disabled. If you would prefer to completely uninstall Adblock, click Remove under Adblock. If the ad-blocking extension's icon is in your address bar, you can click it to disable it for the site you're currently browsing without turning it off completely.

steps.title: Click or tap the three-dot menu in Chrome ⠇.
steps.content: Click or tap the three-dot menu in Chrome ⠇ . Google Chrome blocks many ads by default, even if you don't install an ad blocker. If you want to turn off Chrome's ad-blocking features, you can use this method. These steps will work on your PC, Mac, or Chromebook.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's near the bottom of the menu. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Privacy & Security.
steps.content: Click Privacy & Security . This appears in the left panel. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click Site Settings.
steps.content: Click Site Settings . It's near the bottom of the Privacy & Security page. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click Additional content settings.
steps.content: Click Additional content settings . It's at the bottom of the page. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click Intrusive ads or Ads.
steps.content: Click Intrusive ads or Ads . You'll see one of these two options, depending on your Chrome version. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click the radio button next to "Any site you visit can show any ad to you."
steps.content: Click the radio button next to "Any site you visit can show any ad to you." This disables the ad blocker in Chrome, allowing all websites to show you any ads. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Go to a website you want to allow to show ads.
steps.content: Go to a website you want to allow to show ads. You can allow ads on a particular website instead of disabling Chrome's built-in ad blocker completely. Start by going to the website you trust.

steps.title: Click the lock icon or the site settings icon.
steps.content: Click the lock icon or the site settings icon. You'll see a locked padlock icon or an icon that looks like two sliders to the left of the web address in the address bar at the top. This displays a drop-down menu. If you don't see a lock icon, click the small "i" in a circle instead. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Click Site settings.
steps.content: Click Site settings . This opens the Site Settings menu for the website you are currently on.

steps.title: Select "Allow" next to Intrusive Ads.
steps.content: Select "Allow" next to Intrusive Ads. It's about 9 options down below "Permissions." This disables the ad blocker on the current website. [10] X Research source You may need to reload the page in your browser to show ads.

steps.title: Go to a website you want to allow to show ads.
steps.content: Go to a website you want to allow to show ads. While you can't disable Chrome's built-in ad blocker entirely on your Android, you can allow ads on individual websites that you trust.

steps.title: Tap the three-dot menu.
steps.content: Tap the three-dot menu. You'll see it at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This opens your Chrome settings.

steps.title: Tap Site settings.
steps.content: Tap Site settings . This opens the Site Settings menu for the website you are currently on.

steps.title: Tap Pop-ups and redirects.
steps.content: Tap Pop-ups and redirects . It's towards the bottom of the menu under the "Content" header.

steps.title: Tap the toggle to turn it on.
steps.content: Tap the toggle to turn it on. The switch will be blue when it's on, meaning pop-ups and redirects are allowed. Now, when you refresh the page , you'll be able to see any ads that were blocked by Chrome's built-in ad blocker.
